From the main menu, go to Settings. Use the slider to change the speed of playback. You can test how the new speed will sound by pressing the TEST button.

From the main menu, go to Record. You can see your list of saved recordings. Press the RECORD button. When you have finished, press STOP. You may then play, save, or delete that recording. Once you have saved the recording, you may select it from the list to edit the name.

From the main menu, go to Keyboard. Choose an octave and press RECORD. When you have finished, press STOP. This will take you to a review page. From here you can view the melody, redo the melody, or save the melody without creating a composition by pressing the SAVE MELODY button.

From the main menu, go to Saved Compositions. Select the composition you wish to edit from the list. Press VIEW/EDIT. Press EDIT MODE. Select the chord you wish to begin editing from. Select the key and scale type you want. Press DONE. Chordinateâ€™s algorithm will run from that chord until the end of the composition. All changes are immediately and automatically saved. If you wish to undo a change, press the UNDO button. However, once you leave the page, all edits are final.

From the main menu, go to Keyboard. Choose an octave and press RECORD. When you have finished, press STOP. This will take you to a review page. From here you can view the melody, redo the melody, or save the melody without creating a composition by pressing the SAVE MELODY button. Press the CHORDINATE button. You have successfully created and saved a composition! You can now view or edit this composition from the Saved Compositions page.
